page.title: 06FARMING
page.content:
BARROWLING FARM
The workers on the farm are J. and R. Fiddler, who have worked on the farm for 27 years. The farm was built in 1600. The workers are self employed and earn an average wage. For farm work they need skill but qualifications are not all that necessary. They work ten hours per day and therefore are not left with much leisure time. The jobs they do on the farm vary from the milking of the cattle to general farm working. On Barrowling Farm there are 160 cows, 35 acres of barley and 125 acres of grass which is used for silage, hay and grazing.
